page.title: 12HEALTH IN CODICOTE/WELWYN
page.content: Danesbury Hospital is a 26 bed unit for physically disabled people between the age of 16-65. Most of the present residents are victims of the wasting disease, Multiple Sclerosis. The Hospital is administered by the East Herts Health Authority. Patients are from Herts and South Beds. It currently costs approximately Â£350 per week to accommodate one patient. Most are long stay but some beds are reserved for short stay, giving relief to caring relatives who look after a disabled person at home. All patients are encouraged to live their lives as fully as possible. Holidays and social activities are arranged by various Associations. Most patients have electric wheelchairs. Danesbury House is a fine Georgian mansion, standing in 9 acres of park- land with splendid views.
